headline: Applied Materials Shares Rise ~4% Following Key Trading Signal

headline: Looking At The Narrative For Applied Materials AMAT As Analyst Views Reset
summary: Why Applied Materials’ Implied Fair Value Shifted So Sharply Applied Materials’ implied fair value has moved from about US$248.44 to roughly US$398.73 per share, a large reset that reflects how analysts are updating their models after recent earnings and guidance. Behind that move, many are assuming stronger annual revenue growth of 14.32% instead of 5.92%, while also trimming the discount rate slightly from 10.57% to 10.48%, which together lift the present value of future cash flows in their...

headline: Goldman Sachs Is Raising Price Targets 10%+ on 4 Blue Chip Dividend Stocks
summary: Founded in 1869, Goldman Sachs is the world’s second-largest investment bank by revenue and ranks 55th on the Fortune 500 list of the largest U.S. corporations by total revenue. The Wall Street white-glove giant offers financing, advisory services, risk distribution, and hedging for the firm’s institutional and corporate clients. headline: Applied Materials to Participate in Upcoming Investor Conferences
summary: SANTA CLARA, Calif., Feb. 17, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Applied Materials, Inc. today announced that members of its management team will participate in fireside chats at upcoming investor conferences. Dr. Prabu Raja, President, Semiconductor Products Group, will participate at the Morgan Stanley Technology, Media & Telecom Conference on Monday, March 2 beginning at 3:20 p.m. PT / 6:20 p.m. ET. headline: Applied Materials (AMAT) Seen Winning Whether WFE Growth Is Market- or Share-Driven
summary: Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) is one of the AI Stocks to Watch. headline: Inflation Cools but AI Heat Still Blisters: A Post-Holiday Market Diagnostic
summary: Despite a promising dip in inflation figures, Wall Street remains on edge as artificial intelligence concerns move beyond tech. As we return from the Presidents' Day break, the divide between AI winners and those struggling to keep pace is becoming the primary driver of market sentiment.

raw.headline: Inflation Cools but AI Heat Still Blisters: A Post-Holiday Market Diagnostic
raw.summary: Despite a promising dip in inflation figures, Wall Street remains on edge as artificial intelligence concerns move beyond tech. As we return from the Presidents' Day break, the divide between AI winners and those struggling to keep pace is becoming the primary driver of market sentiment.

headline: Nasdaq Down 50 Points, Records Weekly Loss: Investor Sentiment Declines Further, Greed Index In 'Fear' Zone
